body:
@shvmgpt116 thanks, I can indeed see this bug occuring also with SQL Server with QueryBugsTest.Nested_contains_with_enum, once the compatibility level is set to under 130; older versions of SQL Server don't yet support OPENJSON, so in those cases the provider is in the same state as Oracle. The It also trips the debug assertion in QuerySqlGenerator.GenerateIn. Note that this test represents a pretty rare edge case which shouldn't affect too many actual queries (but of course I'll work on a fix).

<details>
<summary>Generated SQL on SQL Server with low compatibility level</summary>

```sql
SELECT [t].[Id], [t].[Type]
FROM [Todos] AS [t]
WHERE CASE
    WHEN [t].[Type] IN (

    ) THEN @__key_2
    ELSE @__key_2
END IN ('0a47bcb7-a1cb-4345-8944-c58f82d6aac7', '5f221fb9-66f4-442a-92c9-d97ed5989cc7')
```

</details>

On a related note, are you planning on implementing the new JSON support for the Oracle provider? For example, the analog of SQL Server's OPENJSON seems to be the [JSON_TABLE](https://docs.oracle.com/en/database/oracle/oracle-database/12.2/adjsn/function-JSON_TABLE.html#GUID-0172660F-CE29-4765-BF2C-C405BDE8369A) function on Oracle. I also know that Oracle has a special JSON type for storing JSON data in an optimized way; I'm currently working on making the PostgreSQL provider support that, you could do similar work on the Oracle side.

Anyway, let me know if you're interested in this direction and need any assistance!

rename.from: EFCore 8 daily label - LINQ with nested 'Contains' is generating incorrect sql

issue.title: Take into account Contains item visitation in SqlNullabilityProcessor

repository.name: efcore
repository.description: EF Core is a modern object-database mapper for .NET. It supports LINQ queries, change tracking, updates, and schema migrations.

issue.body:
When visiting non-subquery InExpression in SqlNullabilityProcessor, we were ignoring the results of visiting the item.

Fixes #32208

body: This turned out to be a symptom of a larger bug where we were ignoring the results of visiting item in SqlNullabilityProcessor.VisitIn; this affects more scenarios beyond this specific query type.

@roji Thanks for confirming the issue. 
I will surely ask for your guidance when working on supporting JSOM_TABLE functionality for Oracle.

issue.title: [release/8.0] Contains nullability processing

repository.name: efcore
repository.description: EF Core is a modern object-database mapper for .NET. It supports LINQ queries, change tracking, updates, and schema migrations.

issue.body:
Fixes #32208, backports #32214

### Description

When doing SQL nullability processing for an non-subquery InExpression (e.g. Contains LINQ operator), the expression's item was visited but the results were discarded, not being taken into account.

### Customer impact

This can cause bugs in any LINQ query containing `x.Contains(y)`, where y (the item) requires some sort of nullability processing. For example, this causes QueryBugsTest.Nested_contains_with_enum to fail when the SQL compatibility level is set to low (but that's just one example).

### How found

Customer reported on 8.0

### Regression

Yes.

### Testing

Added tests.

### Risk

Very low; a quirk has been added.
